elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the following questions about the factual text "What is an apprenticeship contract?".

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Is a verbally concluded apprenticeship contract valid?
elements.correctAnswer: No, it must be in writing.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Name the parties to the apprenticeship contract.
elements.correctAnswer: Training company/vocational training supervisor, apprentice or learner; for minors: legal representative.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What authorization is required for an apprenticeship contract to be valid?
elements.correctAnswer: The approval of the cantonal vocational training office.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: List the points that must be regulated in the apprenticeship contract.
elements.correctAnswer: Type of vocational training; duration of apprenticeship and probationary period; working hours; vacations and public holidays; salary.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: How long does the probationary period normally last?

elements.name: question6
elements.title: In which cases can an apprenticeship be terminated prematurely?
elements.correctAnswer: If the persons responsible for vocational training or the representatives of the persons responsible for vocational training do not have the professional or personal skills required for the training; if the learner does not have the skills required for the training or is in a state of health or morally at risk; if the training cannot be completed or can only be completed under significantly changed circumstances.
